October27,2014 
Getting ready for Open Enrollment A guide to your options 
Dear Gerard Arthus, 
Thanks for choosing Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield for your health care coverage. We value you as a member ana wouia ike to helo vou understand your health planoptions for 2015. 
Youwilautomaticallyere-enrolled inyourcurrent lanfor5.owever if youwould lik tonrollinadierent lanyouan during Open Enrollment which starts on November 15, 2014. To help make it easy for you, we are providing this packet of information about vouroptions.Here'swhat's included,and considered part of this letter: 
Open Enrollment Guide. This guide shows your plan options, any rate changes, and how to enroll or stay coverea. Medical Benefit ComparisonChartThis shows changes you willsee starting January ,2015 if you keep your current plan.   
Billing and Payment Options. This shows you the many options you have to pay your bill including the convenient way to pay through bank auto withdrawal.   
Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMs) Notice.The Department of Health and Human Services requires us to give a copy of this notice to you.   
HIPAA/NcQA Notice. We know your privacy is important We send out these notices each year to keep you up-to-date on how we protect your health information.   
Notice of language assistance. Health plans and health insurers are required by law to provide language assistance services to our members with Limited English Proficiency (LEP) at no cost.

If you decidetomake achangefor2015,pleasemake your2015healthplandecisonbyDecember15214,tomake sureyour newcoveragestartsJanuary1,2015.

First, take alook at yourOpen Enrolment Guide toreviewall of your planoptionshen, if youhaveanyquestions,lease contat us at the numberlisted in your guide.We're here tohelp. 

JosephGilbert RVP,Individual and SmallGroup Sales Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield

# 
We're so glad you chose us foryourhealth coverage thisyear,and we'llbe here foryou again in theyear ahead.We want to make it easy for you to understand your choices. lt could even be as simple as keeping your current plan anotheryearjustbypayingyourpremium. 
# 
You can count on us to continue providing reliable health coverage that meets the requirements of the Affordable Care Act(ACA).With your current plan,you will continue to get $100\%$ coverage forACA-allowed preventive care and no outof-pocket costs for immunizations,preventive care check-ups,and more.You also get access to health and wellness resources andspecial discounts to help you takecareofyour health. 
Here are two choices for you: 

All you need to do is continue paying your monthly premium on time the same way youpay today.You'll notice thesechanges,which willstartJanuary1,2015: 
Keep your current plan 
Your medical plan name will change from Anthem Essential DirectAccess-cbam to AnthemSilverPathway $2850/15\%$ Yourmedical monthlyratewill be $\$830.30$ Keybenefit changesare included in the enclosed Medical Benefit Comparison Chart.   
You can view a complete list of benefits at sbc.anthem.com/dps/CcD1GFL duringOpenEnrollment. 

If yourneedshave changed,herearesome easyways to shop and enroll between November15,2014andFebruary15,2015: 
Visit ChangeMyCoverage.com to compare plans and review a list of in-network providers. Contact yourbroker or agent. O Call oneof ourHealthPlanAdvisors at 1-844-590-9348 
Choose a different Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield planby December15,2014\*\* 
# 
If you have questions about any of your choices, call your agent or one of our Health Plan Advisors at 1-844-590-9348, Monday-Friday,8:00 a.m.-7:00 p.m.EST.Well work to find a plan that's right for you and help you enroll.

# 
# 
The Affordable Care Act requires all individual health plans to include coverage for ten Essential Health Benefits.These benefits are part of yourhealth plan and include pediatric dental care. In 2014,you may have had a separate policy for pediatric dental careThis policy will be cancelled effectiveDecember31, 2014.Starting January 1, 2015, coverage for pediatric dental care will be part of your medical policy and subject to your medical deductible and out-of-pocket maximum. 
You maybe abletoget financialhelpcalled a ubsidyif youhave odified adustd grossncomf $\$11,670$ \$46,680 for indviduals(or $\$23,850$ to \$95,400 fo a familyof four). But in order to apply for and receiv financial help, you have to buy your coverage through the Health Insurance Marketplace in Indiana at healthcare.gov.For help choosing a plan that meets your needs, contact your agent or one of our Health Plan Advisors at 1-844-590-9348. 
YoucanstilhoosenthmlantheMarkelaceThatwayoulcontinutgetealthcareenefitsoverag from us and also get financial help. 
Ifyouhavependentswhwi tu6yearof agebeforeJanuay015,theywontbabltostaynyourlan They're covered under your current policy until the end of the month in which they turn age 26.We' send you information about their choices soon. 
If youhavebilling,claims orotherissues,easecali thenumberonthebackof yourIDcard. 
# 
Although we make changes each year,wework hard to giveyou access to the doctors, hospitals and pharmacies you know and trust. Knowing your network and pharmacy benefits is important to you. 
For a list of participating in-network providers,visit ChangeMyCoverage.com. To see if your medicines are covered under the pharmacy benefit,visit anthem.com/INSelectdrugtier4.

Effective January 1,2015 
Name:Gerard Arthus

For your plan in 2015, the way youpay today will be the same.Youmight need to update some important information (see the chart below), but the way you pay willstay the same. Your payment is required to keep your plan active or start your new plan for2015. 
We offer many convenient ways to pay your billisted below. One of these ways is automatic bank withdrawal. If you don't pay this way today, it's easy to sign up! See below for more information. Let us take care of sending in your payment so you don't have toworry about writing checks ormailing your payment.

# 
Dear Policyholder, 
Yourhealth insurancecoverage iscoming upforrenewal.OnJanuary1,2015,youwillbe automaticallyre-enrolled and can keep your current coverage. Below are changes wellbe making to your plan along with options to consider to possibly lower yourcosts.You also have the option tochoose a newplan. 
# 
Premium-Your new premium starts in January.Your monthly premium will be $\$830.30$ Checktoseeifyouhave other options or can get a tax credit at: the Health Insurance Marketplace ("the Marketplace) at HealthCare.gov PlanName-Your newplan namewill beAnthem SilverPathway $2850/15\%$ andyourplanIDwillbe17575IN077010500. Benefit changes,which include but may not be limited to deductible and cost share, are detailed in the enclosed MedicalBenefitComparisonChart. 
This plan isn't being offered through the Marketplace. If you qualify for lower costs on monthly premiums or lower out-of-pocket costs, you can get those savings only if you enroll in a plan through the Marketplace. 
# 
The2015OpenEnrollment period is fromNovember15,2014 toFebruary15,2015. lf youwant a newplanwith coveragethatstartsonJanuary1,2015,thedeadlinetoenroll isDecember15,2014. You may be able to choose a new health plan from Anthem or another insurance company through the Marketplace You or your family may also qualify for Medicaid or the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHiP). You can choose to buy a new health plan outside the Marketplace—directly from an insurance company or with the help of an agent orbroker.Butremember:lf you qualify for lowercosts,you can get those savings only if you enroll throughtheMarketplace. 
# 
Call or visit the plan's website tomake sure your doctor and other health care providers willbe in the plan network next year.   
Also check tomakesure anyprescriptionmedicationsyou takewillbecovered. 
# 
Call a Health Plan Advisor at 1-844-590-9348, Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. EST. Visit HealthCare.gov or call 1-800-318-2596 (TTY: 1-855-889-4325)23 to learn more about the Health Insurance Marketplace.
